    public class Screen
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

    1.2
    Author:
    Group 3

      • Screen

        public Screen(Player p)
        constructs a new screen for Player p
        Parameters:
        p - associated Player object who owns this screen

    • Method Detail

      • setUpScreen

        public void setUpScreen()
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        set up screen for setUp phase, i.e., during ship placement
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • gamePlayScreen

        public void gamePlayScreen()
        set up screen for game play,i.e., during attacking of opponent's ship

      • setFirstGameP2

        public void setFirstGameP2(boolean b)
        Needed in Computer mode sets a flag if Computer has found a hit on opponent's board so that correct strategy is applied When true, Computer attacks random cells Once Computer finds a hit, the flag is set so that from the next time onwards it hits according to probability distribution
        Parameters:
        b - true if computer has not hit anything yet, false otherwise

      • getSelfBoard

        public SelfBoard getSelfBoard()
        Returns:
        self board (where player's ships are placed)

      • getAttackBoard

        public AttackBoard getAttackBoard()
        Returns:
        attack board (where player is selecting shots to target)

      • getFleetAttack

        public FleetAttack getFleetAttack()
        Returns:
        center panel which shows the status of self and enemy ship health

      • getTimer

        public timer getTimer()
        Returns:
        timer of this player

      • getSubmit

        public javax.swing.JButton getSubmit()
        Useful to control game play. For example, once the second player ship placement is complete, this method is called to initiate attack phase
        Returns:
        hidden submit button of screen which is deliberately fired to move on to next phase

      • getTimerLabel

        public javax.swing.JLabel getTimerLabel()
        This method is called by player's timer object to set the text
        Returns:
        timer label of this player

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Listener to hidden submit button Useful to control listeners of players' self and attack board This method is called upon during the following types of events: 1. After Player 1's fleet placement is complete, display Player 2's self board 2. After Player 2's fleet placement is complete, initiate game by calling Player 1 screen's gamePlayScreen() 3. During attack phase, after each player's turn, display the other player's gamePlayScreen()
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        See Also:
        ActionListener.actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent)

      • updateShots

        public void updateShots(int sh)
        update the text of "Shots left:" panel
        Parameters:
        sh - number of shots left this turn
